info.title: Shopify
info.description: Add a Shopify Instance to connect your existing Shopify account

patch.summary:
Update a customer associated with a given ID in Shopify. The update
API uses the PATCH HTTP verb, so only those fields provided in the customer
object will be updated, and those fields not provided will be left alone.
Providing an ID that does not exist will result in an error response.

parameters.name: customerId
parameters.description: The ID of the customer to update in Shopify.

requestBody.description: The customer object, with those fields that are to be updated.

400.description: Bad Request - Often due to a missing request parameter

401.description:
Unauthorized - An invalid element token, user secret and/or
org secret provided

403.description: Forbidden - Access to the resource by the provider is forbidden

404.description: Not found - The requested resource is not found

405.description:
Method not allowed - Incorrect HTTP verb used, e.g., GET used
when POST expected

406.description:
Not acceptable - The response content type does not match the
'Accept' header value

409.description: Conflict - If a resource being created already exists

415.description:
Unsupported media type - The server cannot handle the requested
Content-Type

500.description: Server error - Something went wrong on the Cloud Elements server

502.description:
Provider server error - Something went wrong on the Provider
or Endpoint's server

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Restrict results to customers specified by a comma-separated list of IDs.

parameters.name: since_id
parameters.description: Restrict results to those after the specified ID.

parameters.name: created_at_min
parameters.description: Show customers created after the specified date. (format 2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00)

parameters.name: created_at_max
parameters.description: Show customers created before the specified date. (format 2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00)

parameters.name: updated_at_min
parameters.description: Show customers last updated after the specified date. (format 2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00)

parameters.name: updated_at_max
parameters.description: Show customers last updated before a specified date. (format 2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00)

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to show.(default 50)(maximum 250)

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Show only certain fields, specified by a comma-separated list of field names.

400.description: Bad Request - Often due to a missing request parameter

401.description:
Unauthorized - An invalid element token, user secret and/or
org secret provided

403.description: Forbidden - Access to the resource by the provider is forbidden

404.description: Not found - The requested resource is not found

405.description:
Method not allowed - Incorrect HTTP verb used, e.g., GET used
when POST expected

406.description:
Not acceptable - The response content type does not match the
'Accept' header value

409.description: Conflict - If a resource being created already exists

415.description:
Unsupported media type - The server cannot handle the requested
Content-Type

500.description: Server error - Something went wrong on the Cloud Elements server

502.description:
Provider server error - Something went wrong on the Provider
or Endpoint's server

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Retrieve only orders specified by a comma-separated list of order IDs from Shopify.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to show on a page default is 50, maximum is 250.

parameters.name: since_id
parameters.description: Show orders after the specified ID.

parameters.name: created_at_min
parameters.description: Show orders created at or after date (format 2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00).

parameters.name: created_at_max
parameters.description: Show orders created at or before date (format 2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00).

parameters.name: updated_at_min
parameters.description: Show orders last updated at or after date (format 2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00). .

parameters.name: updated_at_max
parameters.description: Show orders last updated at or before date (format 2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00).

parameters.name: processed_at_min
parameters.description: Show orders imported at or after date (format 2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00).

parameters.name: processed_at_max
parameters.description: Show orders imported at or before date (format 2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00).

parameters.name: attribution_app_id
parameters.description: Show orders attributed to a certain app, specified by the app ID. Set as `current` to show orders for the app currently consuming the API.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Filter orders by their status.(default open)

parameters.name: fulfillment_status
parameters.description: Filter orders by their fulfillment status.(default any)

400.description: Bad Request - Often due to a missing request parameter

401.description:
Unauthorized - An invalid element token, user secret and/or
org secret provided

403.description: Forbidden - Access to the resource by the provider is forbidden

404.description: Not found - The requested resource is not found

accepts_marketing.description:
Indicates whether the customer has consented to be sent marketing
material via email. Valid values are true or false
accepts_marketing.x-conditionally-required-description:
At least one of the accepts_marketing,email,first_name,last_name,note,phone,tax_exempt,tags
fields must be provided for successful PATCH request

email.description:
The unique email address of the customer. Attempting to assign
the same email address to multiple customers will return an error
email.x-conditionally-required-description:
At least one of the accepts_marketing,email,first_name,last_name,note,phone,tax_exempt,tags
fields must be provided for successful PATCH request

first_name.x-conditionally-required-description:
At least one of the accepts_marketing,email,first_name,last_name,note,phone,tax_exempt,tags
fields must be provided for successful PATCH request

last_name.x-conditionally-required-description:
At least one of the accepts_marketing,email,first_name,last_name,note,phone,tax_exempt,tags
fields must be provided for successful PATCH request

id.description: A unique numeric identifier for the customer

note.x-conditionally-required-description:
At least one of the accepts_marketing,email,first_name,last_name,note,phone,tax_exempt,tags
fields must be provided for successful PATCH request

phone.description:
The unique phone number for this customer. Attempting to assign
the same phone number to multiple customers will return an error
phone.x-conditionally-required-description:
At least one of the accepts_marketing,email,first_name,last_name,note,phone,tax_exempt,tags
fields must be provided for successful PATCH request

tax_exempt.description:
Indicates whether the customer should be charged taxes when
placing orders. Valid values are true or false
tax_exempt.x-conditionally-required-description:
At least one of the accepts_marketing,email,first_name,last_name,note,phone,tax_exempt,tags
fields must be provided for successful PATCH request

tags.description:
Tags are additional short descriptors formatted as a string
of comma-separated values. For example, if an article has three tags:
tag1, tag2, tag3.
tags.x-conditionally-required-description:
At least one of the accepts_marketing,email,first_name,last_name,note,phone,tax_exempt,tags
fields must be provided for successful PATCH request

CustomerPATCH.description:
A customer resource instance represents a customer account with
the shop.

buyer_accepts_marketing.description:
Indicates whether the person who placed the order would like
to receive email updates from the shop. This is set when the customer
selects the Submit to our newsletter checkbox during checkout. The store's
settings about email marketing don't affect this value

created_at.description:
This auto-generated property is the date and time when the
order was created in Shopify, in ISO 8601 format

currency.description:
The three letter code (ISO 4217) for the currency used for
the payment.

id.description:
The unique numeric identifier for the order. This one is used
for API purposes.This is different from the order_number property

line_items.description:
A list of line item objects, each one containing information
about an item in the order

name.description: The customer's order name as represented by a number.

number.description:
Numerical identifier unique to the shop. A number is sequential
and starts at 1000

processed_at.description:
The date and time when the order was imported, in ISO 8601
format

processing_method.description: States the type of payment processing method

subtotal_price.description: Price of the order before shipping and taxes

taxes_included.description: States whether or not taxes are included in the order subtotal

total_discounts.description:
The total amount of the discounts to be applied to the price
of the order

total_line_items_price.description: The sum of all the prices of all the items in the order

total_price.description:
The sum of all the prices of all the items in the order, taxes
and discounts included (must be positive)

total_tax.description: The sum of all the taxes applied to the order (must be positive)

total_weight.description:
The sum of all the weights of the line items in the order,
in grams.

updated_at.description:
Date and time when the order was last modified. The API returns
this value in ISO 8601 format

cancel_reason.description:
The reason why the order was cancelled. If the order was not
cancelled, this value is null.If the order was cancelled, the value will
be one of the customer,fraud,inventory,declined,other

cancelled_at.description:
The date and time when the order was cancelled. If the order
was cancelled, the API returns this value in ISO 8601 format. If the order
was not cancelled, this value is null.

Order.description:
An order is a customer's completed request to purchase one or more
products from a shop. An order is created when a customer completes the checkout
process, during which time they provide an email address or phone number,
billing address and payment information

accepts_marketing.description:
Indicates whether the customer has consented to be sent marketing
material via email. Valid values are true or false

created_at.description:
The date and time when the customer was created.The API returns
this value in ISO 8601 format

email.description:
The unique email address of the customer. Attempting to assign
the same email address to multiple customers will return an error

id.description: A unique numeric identifier for the customer

phone.description:
The unique phone number for this customer. Attempting to assign
the same phone number to multiple customers will return an error

updated_at.description:
The date and time when the customer information was updated.
The API returns this value in ISO 8601 format

OrderCustomer.description:
A customer resource instance represents a customer account with
the shop.

fulfillment_service.description:
Service provider who is doing the fulfilment,Valid values
are either manual or the name of the provider. eg: amazon, shipwire,
etc

gift_card.description:
States whether or not the line_item is a gift card. If so,
the item is not taxed or considered for shipping charges

name.description: The name of the product variant

price.description: The price of the item before discounts have been applied

product_id.description:
The unique numeric identifier for the product in the fulfilment.Can
be null if the original product associated with the order is deleted at
a later date

quantity.description: The number of products that were purchased

taxable.description: States whether or not the product was taxable

variant_id.description: The id of the product variant

vendor.description: The name of the supplier of the item

total_discount.description:
The total discount amount applied to this line item. This value
is not subtracted in the line item price

id.description: The id of the line item

OrderLineItem.description:
A list of line item objects, each one containing information about
an item in the order

country.x-conditionally-required-description:
If province or province_code is present
then either country or country_code must be present

country_code.description:
The two-letter country code corresponding to the customer's
country
country_code.x-conditionally-required-description:
If province or province_code is present
then either country or country_code must be present

id.description: A unique numeric identifier for the address

phone.description: The customer's phone number for this mailing address

zip.description: The customer's zip or postal code

customer_id.description: A unique numeric identifier for the customer

CustomerAddress.description:
A customer address resource instance represents one of the many
addresses a customer may have

accepts_marketing.description:
Indicates whether the customer has consented to be sent marketing
material via email. Valid values are true or false

addresses.description: A list of the ten most recently updated addresses for the customer

created_at.description:
The date and time when the customer was created.The API returns
this value in ISO 8601 format

email.description:
The unique email address of the customer. Attempting to assign
the same email address to multiple customers will return an error

id.description: A unique numeric identifier for the customer

last_order_id.description: The id of the customer's last order

last_order_name.description:
The name of the customer's last order. This is directly related
to the Order's name field

orders_count.description: The number of orders associated with this customer

multipass_identifier.description: The customer's identifier used with Multipass login

phone.description:
The unique phone number for this customer. Attempting to assign
the same phone number to multiple customers will return an error

tax_exempt.description:
Indicates whether the customer should be charged taxes when
placing orders. Valid values are true or false

state.description:
The state of the customer's account in a shop. The state can
be changed in the shop admin or by the customer, but not through the API

tags.description:
Tags are additional short descriptors formatted as a string
of comma-separated values. For example, if an article has three tags:
tag1, tag2, tag3.

total_spent.description:
The total amount of money that the customer has spent at the
shop

updated_at.description:
The date and time when the customer information was updated.
The API returns this value in ISO 8601 format

verified_email.description: States whether or not the email address has been verified

Customer.description:
A customer resource instance represents a customer account with
the shop.

country.x-conditionally-required-description:
If province or province_code is present
then either country or country_code must be present

country_code.description:
The two-letter country code corresponding to the customer's
country
country_code.x-conditionally-required-description:
If province or province_code is present
then either country or country_code must be present

phone.description: The customer's phone number for this mailing address

zip.description: The customer's zip or postal code

Address.description:
A customer address resource instance represents one of the many
addresses a customer may have

preDefinedActions.name: Update a customer associated with a given ID in Shopify.

preDefinedEvents.name: Retrieve a list of customers from Shopify

limit.title: Limit
limit.description: The maximum number of results to show (maximum 250)

baseUrl.title: baseUrl
baseUrl.description: The baseUrl of the provider e.g. https://shopname.myshopify.com/admin/api/YOURAPIVERSION
